intro: Minuartia striata subsp. kitaibelii, commonly known as the rock lettuce, is a low-growing, mat-forming plant characterized by its small, fleshy, and often blue-green leaves. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is typically found in rocky or gravelly habitats. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments and is often found in alpine or coastal regions. Its succulent leaves help it retain moisture in harsh conditions.
